attributes.action: Referendum on the Danish option for UK devolved regions to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Danemark but not in the EU.

We request that the regions that voted RemaIN, should  remain part of the EU, and the regions that voted leave, to be outside the EU, without breaking up the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We hereby call on the elected representatives of all the areas that voted RemaIN to negotiate with the EU to enable our clearly expressed wishes to remain EU citizens, and to press the UK government to explore all possible options in our relationship with the EU.

We request that the UK government hold a new referendum on all realistic possible options for the relationship between the UK and the EU, before the UK government starts the formal process for the UK to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Greater devolution of powers to Greater London - like Scotland, NI and Wales
attributes.background: Considering the size of London's population and the unique challenges it faces, London should have a similar say in these matters, with further powers devolved to the London Assembly and London given more control over its finances to focus on its own priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
Greater London is economically and socially distinct from England. We know this from recent polls and elections.

Areas with smaller populations and economies (London's being larger than many European nations) have gained powers through devolution, e.g. the Northern Ireland Assembly, Scottish Parliament and National Assembly of Wales. They are responsible for areas such as infrastructure, health and education as these countries are best suited to make their own decisions within their borders.

attributes.action: Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK
attributes.background:
Millions of EU citizens have been working in the UK for many years, many children were born in the UK from EU citizens, and as such, see Britain as their home as they grew up here and were taught the same values as all other British Children.
What conditions can you provide for them after Brexit?
attributes.additional_details:
Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK - immediately and without delay!

These families are all currently experiencing uncertainty and fear. Let them know what they can expect from the Government and don't keep them in the dark. They didn't have the right to vote in the Referendum, but they do have the right to know what will happen to their families, workplaces, mortgages, student loans and education, as well as safety and welfare.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to hold a second BREXIT referendum until 2036.
attributes.background: A referendum has already been held, and democracy is not about taking a second vote if you aren't happy with the first.

attributes.action: Free public transport for teenagers.
attributes.background: Provide free public transport for teenagers (<20 years old). This will encourage green travel, reduce road fatalities and seriously injured for this age group and will help young job seekers to find work further from home without large travel cost burden.

attributes.action: Continue a pro immigration policy and recognise the value migrants bring the UK
attributes.background: As part of the EU exit negotiations the UK government should seek a deal that will maintain the current rights of all EU citizens in the UK and that will keep the UK border open to economic migrants and refugees alike.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition the UK government should take steps to fully explain to the public the great benefits that migration brings to the UK.

A large number of people who voted to leave in the recent referendum will have done so as a rejection of the federalist agenda of the EU and in favour of national sovereignty and democracy. They did not vote for a rejection of migrants or as a vote to close our borders. As such there is no mandate for a anti immigration policy

attributes.action: HM Government to initiate talks to allow Scotland to remain in the E.U.
attributes.background: Greenland exited the E.U. (E.E.C) in 1985, while Denmark remained within the EU. On that basis, as it's the will of the Scottish people (via the Referendum of 23/06/16) to remain within the E.U,  both Holyrood and Westminster to discuss arrangements that will Scotland alone to remain in the E.U.
attributes.additional_details: Reference to the UK referendum of 23/06/16 confirms it is the will of the Scottish people to remain within the European Union. Scotland does not agree with England and Wales and is being dragged, against its sovereign will out of the European Union.

attributes.action: Delay submission of intent to leave the EU (Article 50) until there is a new PM
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum to leave the EU & the subsequent resignation of the PM it would not be in the UK's best interests to rush the submission of our intention to leave until a new leadership is in place.  This must be delayed until at least October to maximise the two year period.
attributes.additional_details: There are reports of EU leaders and other member states wanting the UK to submit the intention to leave immediately and begin the two year notice / negotiation period.  Given the likely duration of a leadership contest and the current target of October 2016 this could result in a rushed process and damage the chances of getting the best possible exit for the UK.  This petition is to delay the submission until a new PM and cabinet are in place so they are able to negotiate without distraction.

attributes.action: All political parties to have equal say in negotiating terms of exit from the EU
attributes.background: The future of Britain after the Referendum is the single most important issue facing us today. Our prosperity, security and well-being, as well as that of the rest of Europe and beyond is too big a responsibility for one group of politicians and cannot be left solely to the current government.
attributes.additional_details: We are told that exit negotiations could take up to two years. Mr Cameron says it should be left until his successor is appointed after October 2016. This could mean that the earliest date for implementation would be October 2018; only 15 months before the next general election which may provide a change of government. Therefore the crucial first years after implementation should involve all parties.

attributes.action: Set up a unity commission to negotiate the terms of Brexit.
attributes.background: Exceptional circumstances require an exceptional response. HM Government should set aside narrow party politics and set up a commission with the power to negotiate the terms of our exit. This must include representatives of all parties, all regions, all backgrounds, and many interest groups.
attributes.additional_details: The terms of Brexit are too important to leave to the interests of a narrow political group. A commission should be set up with the power to negotiate our exit. This would allow the nation to draw together politicians from all parties who polled more than 5% at the last general election. Members should also be appointed from business, education, unions, the law, charities, public services, security and the economy. The negotiated terms will be legally binding on the government of the day.

attributes.action: Allow the registration of 15 year olds, enabling them eligibility to vote at 16
attributes.background: Young people should be allowed to vote in all local and national elections and referendums. During the recent European referendum, an increasing amount of younger people were voicing frustration at not being allowed to take part in the democratic process.
attributes.additional_details: Younger people are becoming increasingly interested in politics at a local, national and global level. It seems unfair that people under 18 should be excluded from a process that has implications on their lives and shapes their long term future. I am calling on the UK parliament to extend the right to vote to all 16 year olds. While recently campaigning, talking to young people indicated to me that they are showing a real enthusiasm and interest in how politics affects their lives.

attributes.action: Debate the legality of denying EU migrants the vote in the EU Ref.
attributes.background: Denying EU migrants, on the electoral roll, the right to vote in the EU referendum contravenes EU law (enshrined in the TFEU, Part 2) on non-discrimination based on nationality.
attributes.additional_details: The outcome of the EU referendum has an impact on the lives of non-British nationals resident in the UK. It will also impact on the lives of their families and children. Consequently they should have the right to vote.

attributes.action: Delay the replacement of Trident till after the imminent Scottish referendum
attributes.background: We've all debated the strong moral and ethical case for the replacement of Britain's nuclear 'deterrent' program. However, following the UK's decision to exit the European Union on the June 23rd this year. There is now a stronger economical and political case to be made against its renewal.
attributes.additional_details: Following the UK's exit from the European Union and the massive decline in the value of the £, the cost of replacing Trident is expected to rise significantly from the Department of Defence's previous estimate of around £40 billion to £60-150 billion. Furthermore, Scotland's potential exit from the union means the current base of the nuclear 'deterrent' in Clyde may no longer be tenable. It is not right that we replace our nuclear weapons for status, a serious debate on this issue is required.

attributes.action: New government to reach an agreement on Free trade and Free movement with the EU
attributes.background:
The  EU  has been the UK's largest trade partner for years. It will be
devastating for our economy to not be able to enjoy free trade with
the  EU  as  a  whole, should the UK actually leave the EU in the near
future. Same goes for free movement of UK citizens in Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Now  that  the  UK  has  voted to leave the EU, I believe it is in the
common  interest  of  British people to have a comprehensive agreement with  the  EU  as  a  whole  rather than with each individual  country, agreement  that  would give us free trade and free movement, something we have so much enjoyed whilst being a part of the EU. EU has been our biggest  trade  partner (collectively) and will continue to be such in the future. This should become the #1 priority of the new UK government.

attributes.action: After the EU vote, we call for the dismantlement of the unelected House of Lords
attributes.background: As the UK has voted to "take back control" from the EU from what was claimed to be a democratically unaccountable Brussels, we propose that the UK should follow this line of reasoning and "take back control" from the un-elected House of Lords by dissolving it.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Parliament contains one of the world's largest decision making bodies called the House of Lords. The peers of this House are un-elected. 

In the EU, the British people could appoint European members of Parliament. But the elected European Parliament is also complemented by un-elected Institutions. The British confirmed they do not want to be apart of this. As the House of Lords is in the British Parliament, the British people have the capability to remove this un-elected House.

attributes.action: The Government to ensure EU funding is replaced on a like-for-like basis.
attributes.background:
A large number of projects across a wide field of endeavor, including such diverse things as scientific research and urban regeneration, are currently funded by the EU. As the UK disengages itself from the EU this funding will be withdrawn.
This could lead to many vital projects being abandoned.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for workers in dog shelters to kill unwanted dogs.
attributes.background: In dog shelters, workers kill unwanted dogs after a certain amount of time, which can be up to a week which doesn't give the dog a chance to live in a happy home where it is wanted. Dogs have feelings too, dogs are a man's best friend!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dogwatchuk.com/death-row-dogs/
attributes.creator_name: Fiona Grezda, Jasmine Murphy, Alma Roe

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to tell lies in Parliament, or to the Public.
attributes.background: It is totally unfair that MP's can consider that their jobs allows them to be dishonest with both Parliament, and the General Public, with no consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at how many MP's have been accused of lying in the Euro Debate.  How are the Public meant to know what to vote for, when all they are hearing are called lies!

attributes.action: Have a serious debate regarding Capital Punishment for murder
attributes.background: This is not a knee jerk reaction to the appalling events in Birstall yesterday but more a reaction to the ease with taking a life has become acceptable, Capital Punishment would hopefully make some people think twice before ending a person's life.
attributes.additional_details: The progress with DNA testing must make it unlikely any one innocent of a crime would be punished in erroras,  I know happened in the past.

attributes.action: Enforce stricter banking regulations for online gambling transactions.
attributes.background: Many online gaming companies offer a self-exclusion service as part of responsible gambling. However, due to the large variety of online gambling sites, it is very easy for problem gamblers to relapse. We want banks to offer a similar self-exclusion service for such transactions being made.
attributes.additional_details: Our suggestions are for a self-exclusion based service being made available by banks to offer a more rigid deterrent to online gambling addicts from which is currently available. We'd also like to see stricter regulations in normal online transactions being made to gambling sites; and question marks being made where large sums are being deposited to help deter online gambling and aid those with addictions or potential addictions to gaming.

attributes.action: A law that restricts roadworks to 5 miles in any 30 mile stretch on a motorway.
attributes.background: Over the past few years there has been significant investment in upgrading our motorway system, this has resulted in many miles of roadworks with restricted road width and an imposed fifty mile an hour speed limited that is monitored. Some roadworks go on for 15 miles plus.
attributes.additional_details: Extended roadworks (greater than 5 miles, Incl lead-in/out) with reduced lanes and a 50 Mile an hour speed limit requires significant levels of concentration. It increases the likelihood of an accident, increases traffic jams, restricts movement, increases the time it takes to get from A to B when the roadworks are for extended miles. Drivers get more frustrated, more likely to speed. When there is a 15 mile stretch of roadworks, on large stretches nobody is working anyway!

attributes.action: Make it law for all bedsheets sold in the UK to be labelled with their size
attributes.background: It's very difficult to guess the difference between the different sizes of sheets sold in Britain. Thousands of wasted person-hours a year could be saved if all sheets were properly labelled so we didn't have to make at least three trips to the airing cupboard every time we wanted to change a bed.

attributes.action: Advise China to make "Compassion for China's Animals" a recognised society.
attributes.background: China has no adaquate animal rights laws, the suffering animals endure there is not acceptable. "Compassion for China's Animals" is a group of activists taking positive steps to help dogs and cats caught up in the dog meat trade but they have no legal backing or government help. this should change
attributes.additional_details: "Compassion for China's animals" has successfully intercepted trucks carrying thousands of dogs in hell on earth conditions heading for slaughter and torture in unimaginable ways, however many of these trucks have been allowed to drive away as these wonderful activists have no government support and aren't recognised - they should be, they need to become, the much needed missing link in China's outdated and inadaquate animal rights laws, with powers of there own to monitor, enforce and amend laws

attributes.action: Charge us more national insurance and properly fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is now running at a huge defecit. This can be easily solved. Charge us more national insurance - double it if you like. Use that money to properly/sustainably fund the NHS for a growing, ageing population. We'd much rather fund a public system for all than pay for private health insurance.

attributes.action: Make a commitment to create a British space elevator (not just a space port).
attributes.background: If we truly want to get in to the space race we need to make a bold move. A space elevator would allow for cheap transport into orbit. The material science is close. We have a possible site in the Ascension Islands and we should take the initiative for once. The commercial possibilities are endless
attributes.additional_details:
Space Elevators in Science Fiction, also see Beanstalks

http://www.extremetech.com/extreme/176625-60000-miles-up-geostationary-space-elevator-could-be-built-by-2035-says-new-study

BBC, Wikipedia

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox £15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Parliament to debate: "It's wrong for UK to remain in democratic deficient EU."
attributes.background: Given that the UK has a centuries long tradition of democratic checks and balances and the EU has severe and structural democratic deficiencies it would be wrong for the UK to remain in the EU as to remain in the EU reduces the democratic means of accountability to the British People:
attributes.additional_details:
The key severe democratic deficiencies of the EU are as follows:

The EU has Four Presidents and NON are Elected
The EU Parliament CANNOT start new or get rid of existing EU Laws nor allow for Private Members or Private Bills
The EU Government (the EU Commission) is NOT Elected is not accountable to us & we CANNOT remove/change it
The EU does not form law in PUBLIC and does not enable people to take part in forming it or accountable public debate on EU law
The EU IS  DEMOCRATICALLY DEFICIENT

attributes.action: Make access to mains gas a legal right for all homes and properties in the UK.
attributes.background: Many families can't access mains gas & are forced to use more expensive forms of fuel for cooking and heating. The gas network often expands when new homes are built close to the existing network, however whole communities have been left behind because they are off grid, often only by a few miles.
attributes.additional_details: Mains gas delivered via a pipeline would instantly remove the damage to the environment caused by the hundreds of millions of carbon related miles from delivery trucks polluting our towns and villages each and every year whilst travelling back and forth delivering alternative expensive fuels such as LPG and oil to off grid homes. These journeys will never stop, there is no alternative. Over 1 million properties many with children and older occupants have no access to mains gas. Thats just wrong.

attributes.action: Make letting agents pay double the holding deposit for cancelling a tenancy.
attributes.background: Currently, letting agents require future tenants to immediately pay holding fees which is later offset against administration and referencing fees. However if letting agent chose to cancel the tenancy, they just return the holding fees and not any interest rate or penalties.
attributes.additional_details: If a letting agent cannot make the property available as per agreed tenancy start date And if the tenancy agreement was not signed by both parties until that time, then tenant has no rights and has to bear substantial consequential losses. If tenant decides to negotiate and threaten to take to property ombudsman (for breach of implied contract), the letting agent can cancel the offer for tenancy by returning just the initial monies with no interest rate and with no penalty.

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to ignore the "No Junk Mail" and "No Callers" Door signs
attributes.background: The "Junk Mail" and "No Callers"  signs are placed on doors by residents in an attempt to stop the need to deal with this menace. But because there is no legal requirement, the wishes of these residents are ignored, and the rights of the residents to not be harassed in their own home are violated.
attributes.additional_details: This type of law is already in place in countries like Australia, and USA

attributes.action: Implement larger capacity trains on Cross Country Train Routes
attributes.background:
Since the start of the CrossCountry train franchise in 2007. Train passengers have doubled and are still increasing however the Franchise still run small 4-5 carriage locomotives.  
Contract for CrossCountry trains is reviewed this year so the Government should consider implementing larger trains.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently CrossCountry Trains implement 3 sets of Trains. 
High Speed Trains that consist of 8 Carriages.
Voyageurs and Super Voyageurs 4-5 Carriages.
Turbo Stars Trains 2-3 Carriages. 

Voyageurs operate in the South West , North East, Scotland, South Coast, North West and North East. They are subject to overcrowding on the majority of routes to unsafe levels of passengers having to stand, sit in non-designated seats and scramble over the first available seat. 

This needs to change.

attributes.action: Prevent the exclusion of primary school children due to their haircuts.
attributes.background: A Birmingham primary school pupil was suspended from his school because his haircut 'wasn't suitable for their school policy' despite looking very smart. If a child has a smart, socially acceptable haircut, they should be allowed to wear it without harassment from their school.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-birmingham-36269041

attributes.action: Stop taxing and means testing veterans service pensions
attributes.background: Veterans are not benefing from their service pensions due to taxation and means testing .

attributes.action: Debate parking on pavements. This practice is a danger to all
attributes.background: I went blind just last year, I have sustained many injuries walking into parked cars, I was even hit on the main road by a hit and run car and sustained minor injuries. I am afraid now to go out. The practice is a danger for disabled, the Blind, Children & Mothers with push chairs.
attributes.additional_details:
This dangerous practice is an obstruction for Disabled people and Mothers with pushchairs and young children having to be forced into the road to pass the vehicle and is a very dangerous manoeuvre I have hundreds of photographs of cars, vans and large lorries parked fully on the footpath and other cars illegally parked which can be sent if you need them. 
And copies of statements of people on social media who believe it is their god given right to park on the pavement outside their house.

attributes.action: Companies to have Defibrillators
attributes.background:
Make it a mandatory requirement for businesses who employ over 50 persons either temporary or permanent to have a AED Automatic external defibrillator.
More than 100 Sudden Cardiac Arrests (SCA) take place in the UK each week with 95% of these being at a workplace.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.suddencardiacarrest.co.uk/

attributes.action: Create a NHS and Care Commission to review and manage all health care in the UK.
attributes.background: The 21st C has brought new challenges to the health and care provision which underpins the well being of all in the UK. It is timely to review the NHS to ensure that it meets modern needs but retains the ethos of equality of services and  provision, free at point of delivery.

attributes.action: Make it law that all public toilets should have baby changing facilities.
attributes.background: Because fathers either have to give their child to a women to take into the ladies toilet to change their nappy, or change their child on the floor of the mens bathroom. It is a violation of the discrimination act that baby changing facilities are not found in mens restrooms.

attributes.action: Legalise muskets, cannons and swords for self defence
attributes.background: Similar to the second amendment in the US, muskets, swords and cannons can be possessed if a relevant licence is held (level 1 for a sword, level 2 for a musket and 3 for a cannon)the weapons cannot be concealed.Also create a body to monitor gun owners and distribute licences.

attributes.action: Put a cap on the monthly rent payments for individuals in the UK
attributes.background: In the county of Dorset the average rent payment for an individual is £400 per month. If an individual is earning the minimum UK wage at £7.00, and working a 40 hour week, this means that almost 50% of their earnings are going towards paying their landlord.
attributes.additional_details:
Considering the high expense of life in general, including rates for food and living costs, car insurance, telephone bills and the other monthly expenditures, this means that tenants are paying a high rate for other important items.
Considering this, the base line is that we in the UK are LIVING TO WORK. This has to change.

My intention is that parliament puts a cap for landlords at 30% of a monthly wage based on minimum wage for tenants in each county.

attributes.action: All new trees planted on Government owned land should be fruit trees
attributes.background: All new trees on Government owned land should be fruit trees and the produce of those trees should be made freely available to members of the public

attributes.action: Pay parity to all recipients of a British retirement Pension.
attributes.background: Unfair treatment to some recipients, in largely Commonwealth countries, where pensions are frozen in some countries, but not others. A classic example is Canada frozen, America not frozen.

attributes.action: Stop the reassessment and resultant refusal of blue badges to disabled people
attributes.background:
A GOVERNMENT SHOULD BE JUDGED UPON HOW IT TREATS ITS LEAST FORTUNATE CITIZENS 
We are in a period of time where disabled people all across the country are being re-assessed for their needs, including their access to a blue badge. Please put a stop to the 1000s of disabled people losing them unjust.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is this reassessment traumatic enough for disabled people, with the potential consequence of losing their ability to confidently leave the house, assessors are in a position where they have to justify their performance through means of denying access to a certain number of people, thus looking to deny future access to a blue badge wherever they see fit. Recently, a family member who cannot walk 50 feet was told her blue badge is being revoked, due to 'evidence' that they can walk fine.

attributes.action: Only British Born Citizens can have: Health Care - Benefits / Housing / Voting
attributes.background: Only British Born Citizens have rights to: Government owned or sponsored Health Care & Housing / Benefits / Voting. Citizens living in the country 20 or more years can have the same rights if they already have British citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Just trying to save UK from outside influences usually only British born citizens and long standing citizens really care about the country and there fellow neighbors.

attributes.action: Let children go on holiday when they like & keep schools open 253 days a year.
attributes.background: Many families are priced out of holidays because traditional school holidays cause peaks in demand. If schools are open all year round families can synchronise their holiday to suit their work commitments. Schools can then arrange catch up lessons for children who have been on holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Long summer holidays disrupt children`s education and inhibit learning.

The economy of the country would benefit as families would not have to rely on expensive holiday child care.

Industry would benefit from parents not having to take time off work due to child care commitments.

Children will receive more education creating a better educated society.

Parents will avoid being fined for taking children out of school.

More full time jobs would be created rather than seasonal employment.

attributes.action: Allow voters to choose to rerun an election if a plurality wish it.
attributes.background: It's clear from the turnout at elections that voters are disenchanted with politics.  Many claim they dislike all candidates. All ballot papers should have an option for None of the above (NOTA). If NOTA gets more votes than any candidate, that area's election should be rerun with new candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Voter turnout in the UK has been on a long-term downward trend.  Before 2000, national elections typically attracted over 70% turnout (see http://www.ukpolitical.info/Turnout45.htm) and 80% in the early 1950s.  Since 2000, general election turnout has been below 70%.  In addition, the ability to reject a slate of candidates would address or ease many of the issues identified in the Parliamentary report here: http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmpolcon/232/23205.htm

attributes.action: Make Burning The UK Flag a Criminal Offence
attributes.background:
There is a rising problem of protesters in this country thinking that is except able to burn and damage the UK flag in public view. 

This should be made a criminal offence as it can cause great distress and can even motivate people to take violent action against said protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
We should respect OUR flag not burn, rip and trample on it just to make a political point. 

That flag represents us all, as a leading country in this world and as one of the most multi-cultural nations. Whether they like it or not it is the flag of our country and we should not be disrespecting it. 

When they burn and damage that flag they are hurting not only our ancestors but they hurt each and every one of us with every knife that rips it and every flame that licks it.

attributes.action: British Army, Royal Navy and RAF shouldn't ban entry for people with autism,
attributes.background: Autism, Aspergers ect.. shouldn't be an automatic ban on entry to the forces this is something that should be assessed on a case by case basis. All the forces have their own doctors who can carry out these tests. Some not all people with autism would work fine within the forces revise the policy!!!!

attributes.action: Stop schools charging a fee to allow children to eat packed lunches.
attributes.background: Some state schools are charging parents up to £1.80 per child daily to eat a packed lunch on school premises. This is as much as the cost of a school meal.  Parents are paying twice to feed their children. The cost is disproportionate to the effort expended by the school to supervise lunchtimes.
attributes.additional_details:
This was uncovered by the teaching union NASUWT and reported in the press on 28th March 2016. 

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationnews/12206157/State-schools-charge-parents-to-let-children-eat-their-own-packed-lunches.html

attributes.action: Stop landlords from discriminating against young people
attributes.background: Landlords legally have the right to disallow young people usually 18-24 from renting their properties. Most use the stereotypical excuse of "they just want to party" or "they wreck the place" I myself have become homeless due to this and discrimination against any characteristic should be banned.

attributes.action: Make the size of motorcyle you are able to get at the age of 19-20 be a 600 cc
attributes.background: it is the threshold of not being too powerful for riders that have been riding for 2 years and allows them to get used to a slightly more powerful bike before they upgrade to an unlimited liscence this will allow bikers to gain vital experience if they feel they are ready to get a larger cc later on
attributes.additional_details:
You are more likly to have a crash on a motorcyle however it should be the riders choice to ride a larger or smaller bike.
This link shows that the rate of deaths caused by motorcycles was falling by 9% in 2012 before the new age restricted Euro laws were applied. And a large number of bike crashes were caused by car drivers not paying attention to them
http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/2015/march/new-accident-stats-show-large-decrease
These are the most up to date statistics
